metadata.title: CVE-2018-5103 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur during mouse event handling due toissues with multiprocess support. This results in a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.6, Firefox ESR < 52.6,and Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
